comments: a(n) is a function of the subfactorials... a(n)= A000166(n+2)-1/3*(n+2)! /Q ie... 1= 9-24/3, 4= 44-120/3, 25=265-720/3... [From _Gary Detlefs_, Dec 17 2009]
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
formula: a(n)=(n+1)(a(n-1)+a(n-2)) [From _Gary Detlefs_, Dec 17 2009]E.g.f. with offset 0: ((2+3*x+x^3)*exp(-x)-2)/(1-x)^4. From int(((9+8*x+6*x^2+x^4)*exp(-x)-8)/(1-x)^5, x) with input 0 for x=0. [From _Wolfdieter Lang_, May 03 2010]
maple: a:=n->n!*sum((-1)^k/k!, k=4..n): seq(a(n), n=3..19); - _Zerinvary Lajos_, May 25 2007a(n) := n-> floor(((n+2)!+1)/E) -(n+2)!/3 [From _Gary Detlefs_, Dec 17 2009]
